page.title: 19THE RIVER HAMBLE
page.content: The River Hamble runs from just above Botley and flows into Southampton Water.It forms part of the Hamble Country Park.It is used mainly for leisure activities such as yachting, canoeing and fishing.The river is tidal and in fact is unusual because it has double tides.The tidal limit is at Botley. The Hamble is one of a group of rivers on tertiary sand and clay.The flow is variable and these rivers are more likely to flood.Along its banks are examples of ancient woodland, artificially drained and "unimproved" meadows and some reed beds.Some of the "unimproved" grassland supports several species of orchid including the marsh and heath spotted orchids.
